result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stacie K Revord

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on December 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

(9:10 AM case called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom.  
Defendant Stacie K Revord appeared by video. Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Stacie K Revord. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Rivard has spoken with the defendant regarding the offer for a DAGP resolution. Attorney Rivard advises the defendant wants to accept the offer, but needs to meet with DAGP Coordinator.
Plea Hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 3 pm (1/2 hour) in person.
Status conference on October 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

2:30 PM case called. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Stacie K Revord in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Stacie K Revord. 
Defense advises they are still waiting on an offer from the State. 
A status conference is scheduled for October 20 2022 at 9:00 AM (in person, 30 min).
Status conference on August 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

9:15 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Stacie K Revord in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Stacie K Revord. 
Court advises defendant of charges and maximum penalties. Defendant waives further reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas- Received by the Court. 
A status conference is scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 2:30 PM (in person, 30 min).

10:58 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Stacie K Revord appeared by video.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard appeared by video for Stacie K Revord. Defendant would like to appear in person for the purpose of today's hearing. 
An arraignment is scheduled for 6/29/22 at 9:15 AM (in person 15 min).
(See Initial Appearance docket event for details of waiver)

Conditions:
No contact with B.G.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores.
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications.
Comply with DHS regarding J.R.

(Case called at 11:05 AM)
Defendant Stacie Revord appears with Attorney Francis Rivard.  Attorney Loralee Clark appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense waives reading of the Complaint.  Defendant advised of her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing- waiver accepted by Court.  Case referred to Branch 3 for further scheduling.  Defendant updates address and phone number with Court.

Conditions:
No contact with B.G.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores.
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications.
Comply with DHS regarding J.R.
